bug.short_desc: Flatpak repo cannot be removed when its runtime is installed
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: I have created a flatpakrepo file for a repo I have already installed (KDE) and from which I have installed a runtime. When I open the flatpakrepo in gnome-software, I'm presented with a possibility to remove it. When clicked, it doesn't do anything.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): gnome-software-3.22.1-1.fc25.x86_64 flatpak-0.6.13-1.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Add a Flatpak repo manually in the commandline 2. Open a corresponding .flatpakrepo file 3. Try to remove the repo
Actual results: It's not removed, you're presented with the possibility to remove it again. There is no error message or anything.
Expected results: The repo should be either removed or there should be an error message or some other indication of what's going on.
Seems I can't install the .flatpakrepo either after removing it manually.
shared-mime-info-1.8-1.fc25 together with gnome-software 3.22.3 update that's already in stable should fix opening .flatpakrepo files.
